issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I have a scaling group that keeps terminating and starting new instances. The only way to debug has been via euca2ools euscale-describe-scaling-activities. We should add some capabilities in the GUI to view scaling activities.

for example:
ACTIVITY	9ead3b28-aaf8-4cb1-94c7-12925e4272cf	2015-08-03T18:47:19.545dak-console	Failed	Not enough resources available: addresses; please stop or terminate unwanted instances or release unassociated elastic IPs and try again, or run with private addressing only

In addition, there is no way to force scaling group deletion, but that's euca-only AFAIK.
fields.summary: Hard to determine source of scaling group problem

comments.body:
Force delete is not eucalyptus specific.

http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_DeleteAutoScalingGroup.html

[~dkavanagh]: The title of this ticket is vaguely worded.  Could we update it to better reflect the description?  Perhaps the title could be "Display scaling group activities in the console to facilitate troubleshooting scaling group issues"?
Dupe of GUI-1521

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1598

Due to the need for some way to debug scaling groups, I added the most recent cause of scaling activity into the scaling group view. The GUI-1521 ticket was pushed off to a later release, so this would get the user *something* in 4.2 with very small code additions.

Need to handle zero events and case where cause may not be populated
also fix template to not iterate over zones.
I've submitted a PR for this, but the screen shot also shows the additional line. Want to make sure you approve the label (as the other text comes from the server).
See Comment.
Did you leave one here?

Huh. Looks like it did not get saved. Here it is:

1. I'd like to use bubble help to tell users how recent "Recent" activities are. [~dkavanagh], could you please concretely define "recent" for scaling group activities? So, past two hours, past two days, past two weeks, etc.?

2. To improve legibility, is it possible to display each "At [date] ..." activity on a separate line separated by a blank line?

In this case, recent means the last activity and the timestamp is more specific. As you point out, that timestamp isn't formatted well. We might be able to improve that, but I'm just showing what the back end provides.

[~dkavanagh], um, well, it looks like the screen capture attachment shows _two_, closely-spaced activities rather than just the last activity. Is that right?

If so, what is "recent activity?"

Yes, it would improve legibility if you could take what the back-end provides and format it so each activity is on a separate line separated by a blank line.

Based on your answers, I will update the mockup for you.
The 2 events in that one sentence are provided together, I think since one caused the other.

OK.  Good, good.

I updated the wireframe to include the new field label, bubble help, and value:

[https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Scaling+group+details]
Updated branch. Btw, took the liberty of re-wording bubble help from "on the scaling group" to "by the scaling group" since the scaling group is doing the actions on behalf of the user.

[~dkavanagh], as you can see in the attached image titled "Scaling group recent activity.png," it looks like the last action is not the only one shown. Three actions are shown.

So, will you please change the Help bubble text from:

_The last action performed by the scaling group_

to

_The last few actions performed by the scaling group_

I updated the mockup here: [https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Scaling+group+details]

I display the same number of things as before. They are simply separated on different lines now. But, they both come from a single "action cause" in the API response. An example is shown here: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeScalingActivities.html

"<Cause>At 2012-04-12T17:31:30Z a user request created an AutoScalingGroup changing the desired capacity from 0 to 1.  At 2012-04-12T17:32:07Z an instance was started in response to a difference between desired and actual capacity, increasing the capacity from 0 to 1.</Cause>"

[~dkavanagh], separating the associated single "action cause" activities onto separate vertical lines is great for users. Much easier to read and understand. Nice job. And thanks for changing "for" to "by."

So, what I think it comes down to is that the computer thinks of the several associated activities in the "action cause" as one activity. But the user thinks of the several associated activities in the "action cause" as different activities. And that makes some sense. The associated actions really are different (they use different verbs), they often happened at different times, and we display them on different lines.

I'm comfortable with the "Recent activity" bubble help of: The last few actions performed by the scaling group

Is the word "actions" a sticking point? Does it mean something special to users in this context? Should we replace it with "activities?"
I updated the help text.

Verified on Macintosh running Chrome Version 45.0.2454.101 (64-bit), Firefox 41.0, and Safari 8.0.8.

Users will appreciate your attention to detail, [~dkavanagh].

UX review passed. Ready for code review.
Will you please do a code review?
PR 1598 merged

Verified.  The recent activity is visible from the scaling group general tab and it appears to be updating based on latest data.
